subject: Marketing
title: The Reciprocity Principle
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Reciprocity Principle.

hook.text: A waiter leaves a mint with your bill. Tips jump 14%. Two mints? Tips jump 23%.

buildup.text: When someone gives us something, we feel compelled to give back.

discovery.text: Reciprocity is hardwired. It sustained human cooperation for millennia.

twist.text: Free samples, free trials, and free content all exploit this ancient instinct.

climax.text: The gift doesn't need to be big. It just needs to feel personal and unexpected.

punchline.text: Give first. The return comes naturally.

quiz.question: What drives the reciprocity principle in marketing?
options: People feel compelled to return favors
People prefer brands that advertise more
People buy based on logical comparison
